abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is highly
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. The performance of the Bank
            is rated satisfactory, given an intense supervision, and the
            contribution of experienced staff, to a well monitored, and
            reported implementation progress. Performance by the
            Borrower is rated highly satisfactory, given a strong
            involvement in project preparation, and that the
            Government's role greatly facilitated the successful
            implementation. Regardless of success, this highly visible
            project draws the following lessons. The need for
            flexibility in project design is strongly emphasized, an
            aspect which could take into account the considerable
            uncertainty in pipeline implementation schedules.
            Uncertainty was also an issue regarding the fast changing
            events, particularly when timely responses are essential.
            Nonetheless, the Bank's management involvement was
            paramount, particularly given the country's political sensitivities.

5081178.majtheme: Rule of law,Environment and natural resource management,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Oil Institution
            Building Project for Georgia is to enhance the capacity of
            Georgian personnel to undertake international negotiations
            in respect of oil pipeline transit.  This will improve
            Georgia's ability to benefit from oil development in
            the Caspian Region by attracting private investment in the
            necessary transport infrastructure.  The project consists of
            four components: a) a feasibility study; b) a training fund;
            c) negotiations advisors; and d) project management.
